intro: Nauclea pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific nauclea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Nauclea pacifica is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and along stream banks.
